rows.text_1_facilitator:
Today we are learning about giving our children praise. 

Praise helps build a positive relationship and encourages good behavior!

Well done for taking time to learn how to strengthen your relationship with your child. It shows you really care!

text_1_facilitator.eng:
Today we are learning about giving our children praise. 

Praise helps build a positive relationship and encourages good behavior!

Well done for taking time to learn how to strengthen your relationship with your child. It shows you really care!

text_2.eng: Let’s reflect on our own experience with praise.

quiz_1_question.eng:
Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.

How did it make you feel?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy!

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Sometimes being praised makes us feel embarrassed, usually because we are not used to it. It will get easier with practice!

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Sometimes, when we are praised for actions that we don't feel we deserve, we get sad. It is okay to feel sad, but remember that just being here is worthy of praise! Keep your chin up!

rows.text_2: Let’s reflect on our own experience with praise.
rows.quiz_1_question:
Think about the last time someone thanked you, or said you did something great.

How did it make you feel?
rows.quiz_1_feedback_1: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel proud.
rows.quiz_1_feedback_2: That's great! Being praised often makes us feel happy!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Sometimes being praised makes us feel embarrassed, usually because we are not used to it. It will get easier with practice!
rows.quiz_1_feedback_4: Sometimes, when we are praised for actions that we don't feel we deserve, we get sad. It is okay to feel sad, but remember that just being here is worthy of praise! Keep your chin up!

rows.text_1_facilitator:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.

Begin by praising your child during your one-on-one time.

text_1_facilitator.eng:
We all feel better when we are praised.

Praising your child when they behave well will make them want to behave that way more often. 

It also creates a positive and loving relationship between you.

Begin by praising your child during your one-on-one time.

media_title.eng: Can you praise yourself for something right now? Tap play to hear how praise can have a positive impact on you and your family.

media_transcript.eng:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!

rows.media_title: Can you praise yourself for something right now? Tap play to hear how praise can have a positive impact on you and your family.
rows.media_transcript:
Greetings, everyone.

When was the last time you were praised? Can you praise yourself for something right now? Praise makes us all feel good. 

It is good to praise our children when they have done well, because when we do that, they will do more of that good behaviour we want to see.

And let's remember to praise ourselves too, for big or small things!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises her son, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, during one-on-one time.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s look at how @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises her son, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, during one-on-one time.

character_1_text.eng: You found one striped sock and one with dots. Let’s find socks that match

rows.character_1_text: You found one striped sock and one with dots. Let’s find socks that match
Another sock! This one is white. It’s frustrating to try to find a matching pair when there are so many clothes to look through.

character_1_text.eng: Another sock! This one is white. It’s frustrating to try to find a matching pair when there are so many clothes to look through.

rows.character_1_text: You are being very patient and looking very hard, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name. Well done for trying. I am happy you are helping me.

character_1_text.eng: You are being very patient and looking very hard, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name. Well done for trying. I am happy you are helping me.

rows.character_1_text:
You found two socks with the same pattern! Well done for not giving up, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name! 

Because you helped me so well, I now have 5 extra minutes to play with you. What would you like to play?

character_1_text.eng:
You found two socks with the same pattern! Well done for not giving up, @data.characters.f3_son_4.name! 

Because you helped me so well, I now have 5 extra minutes to play with you. What would you like to play?

rows.text_1_facilitator: Let’s reflect on what we saw.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Let’s reflect on what we saw.

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: To boost his self-esteem and confidence

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, he feels good about himself.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: To help him deal with his frustration

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, he will want to keep looking for the socks!

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: To encourage him to want to help more often

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Exactly! When @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, he will remember being praised and be more likely to help with chores in the future!

rows.quiz_1_feedback_3: Exactly! When @data.characters.f3_mother.name praises @data.characters.f3_son_4.name, he will remember being praised and be more likely to help with chores in the future!

text_2.eng: When @data.characters.f3_mother.name gives @data.characters.f3_son_4.name a hug and extra playtime together, she rewards him and encourages him to stay patient and keep helping with chores.

quiz_1_question.eng: What else can we learn from @data.characters.f3_mother.name in how she praises @data.characters.f3_son_4.name?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: True! All @data.characters.f3_mother.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: She uses his name and makes eye contact

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: True! All @data.characters.f3_mother.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: True! All @data.characters.f3_mother.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important..

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: She praises him for the process of trying and not for the result

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: True! All @data.characters.f3_mother.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

quiz_1_option_5_text.eng: She does not criticise his mistake

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: True! All @data.characters.f3_mother.name’s actions show us that the way we give praise is also important.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Here are some easy tips for how to use praise and rewards.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Here are some easy tips for how to use praise and rewards.

section_1_text.eng: Be on the lookout for good behaviour! When offering praise, focus on anything positive or helpful your child does or attempts to do.

section_1_extra_text.eng:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.

section_2_text.eng: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.

section_2_extra_text.eng:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.

section_3_text.eng: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that you have praised them for.

section_3_extra_text.eng:
Rewards should be simple and free. 

Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.

rows.section_1_text: Be on the lookout for good behaviour! When offering praise, focus on anything positive or helpful your child does or attempts to do.
rows.section_1_extra_text:
Pause and really notice when they are doing something positive. Even if it’s expected of them.

Praise your child for *trying*. This boosts their self-esteem and confidence, which helps them to learn new behaviours.
rows.section_2_text: Praise them when you see them do something you like. Do this every day – even if it’s something really small.
rows.section_2_extra_text:
Tell them specifically what they have done well.

Be enthusiastic and really mean it!

You can show your praise with a big smile and words.
rows.section_3_text: Give your child a simple, free reward to encourage them to do more of the behaviours that you have praised them for.
rows.section_3_extra_text:
Rewards should be simple and free. 

Give your child a hug, extra playtime together, or make their favourite meal. 

Simple rewards can be a big motivation for your child to keep trying and show more positive behaviour.

rows.text_1_facilitator: Now that you have learned a few tips for how to use praise, think of one thing YOU have done well recently.

text_1_facilitator.eng: Now that you have learned a few tips for how to use praise, think of one thing YOU have done well recently.

quiz_1_question.eng: Remember to also praise yourself for the good work you're doing! What’s one way you can reward yourself for your hard work as a parent?

quiz_1_option_1_text.eng: Treat yourself to something you enjoy (e.g., a favorite snack or activity)

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: Great choice! Taking time to enjoy something you love is a wonderful way to recharge and recognize your efforts as a parent.

quiz_1_option_2_text.eng: Take a few minutes to relax (e.g., meditation, a short walk, or just some quiet time)

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: Well done! Giving yourself a moment to relax is so important. You’re doing a great job, and it’s okay to take a break.

quiz_1_option_3_text.eng: Celebrate by acknowledging your achievements (e.g.talking to a friend)

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: Fantastic! Reflecting on your accomplishments helps you see how much you’re doing right. You deserve to celebrate your hard work!

quiz_1_option_4_text.eng: Do something fun with your child that you both enjoy

quiz_1_feedback_4.eng: Wonderful choice! Sharing a fun activity with your child not only rewards you but also strengthens your bond. You’re doing an amazing job!

quiz_1_feedback_5.eng: Great idea! However you choose to reward yourself, it’s important to acknowledge the effort you put into parenting. You deserve it!

rows.text_1_facilitator: Your home activity is to praise your child for 3 things every day, and praise yourself too for all your hard work being a parent – you deserve it!

text_1_facilitator.eng: Your home activity is to praise your child for 3 things every day, and praise yourself too for all your hard work being a parent – you deserve it!

media_title.eng: A simple praise made a big impact to @data.characters.media_female_2.name's family. Tap play to hear how praise can help you too.

media_transcript.eng:
When we learned about this praising thing, I thought “We were never praised for things as children, so why should we start now?”. But I got interested when I learned what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after learning about praise, I noticed my son doing what he does every day: Packing away his toys after playing. And I said “Thank you for packing away your toys, my boy, it really makes me happy that you are helping out to keep the house tidy.” My son was smiling and he even came to give me a hug, which he never does. 

This praising business is hard. I still forget to do it sometimes. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!

quiz_1_question.eng: Can you praise your child today?

quiz_1_feedback_1.eng: That's great! Parents who practise praise at home get better results!

quiz_1_feedback_2.eng: You can do it! Try praising your child for something simple at first, like putting away their toy.

quiz_1_feedback_3.eng: That's okay. With time, giving praise will become easier. Try to praise yourself for something first, like "Good job using @global.app_name. It shows you care."

quiz_2_question.eng:
What is one behaviour your child regularly shows in their daily routine that you can praise them for?
There are lots of right answers to this one!

quiz_2_feedback_1.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_feedback_2.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_feedback_3.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_feedback_4.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_option_5_text.eng: Getting ready for school or bed

quiz_2_feedback_5.eng: Yes, you can praise them for these behaviours… and many more!

quiz_2_feedback_6.eng: That’s right! However you choose to praise your child is a great choice. You can praise and reward them when they have done something well. Praise is a powerful parenting skill!

When we learned about this praising thing, I thought “We were never praised for things as children, so why should we start now?”. But I got interested when I learned what the benefits of praising could be.

Right after learning about praise, I noticed my son doing what he does every day: Packing away his toys after playing. And I said “Thank you for packing away your toys, my boy, it really makes me happy that you are helping out to keep the house tidy.” My son was smiling and he even came to give me a hug, which he never does. 

This praising business is hard. I still forget to do it sometimes. But praising really makes a difference. I never thought that a simple praise could make such a change in a person!
